sentence.Network_en: I'm a limited and obtuse clergyman while you're the expert.
sentence.Network_cn: 你是专家，而我是个能力有限的愚笨牧师。

sentence.Network_en: You were too obtuse to take the hint.
sentence.Network_cn: 你太迟钝了,没有理解这种暗示.

derivation.yuyuan_name: late Middle English ( in the sense blunt): from Latin obtusus, past participle of obtundere 'beat against' (see obtund)

entry.def: Someone who is obtuse has difficulty understanding things, or makes no effort to understand them.

example.ex: I've really been very obtuse and stupid...
I'm a limited and obtuse clergyman while you're the expert.
example.tran: 你是专家，而我是个能力有限的愚笨牧师。

entry.def: An obtuse angle is between 90˚ and 180˚.

means.word_mean: 1. of an angle; between 90 and 180 degrees
2. of a leaf shape; rounded at the apex

sentences.sentence: "too obtuse to grasp the implications of his behavior"
"a purblind oligarchy that flatly refused to see that history was condemning it to the dustbin"- Jasper Griffin

means.word_mean: 4. slow to learn or understand; lacking intellectual acuity;

sentences.sentence: "so dense he never understands anything I say to him"
"although dull at classical learning, at mathematics he was uncommonly quick"- Thackeray
"dumb officials make some really dumb decisions"
"he was either normally stupid or being deliberately obtuse"

auth_sentence.content: Our machines, in contrast, have been obtuse to them.
auth_sentence.res_content: Our machines, in contrast, have been obtuse to them.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Our machines, in contrast, have been obtuse to them.

auth_sentence.content: Or the obtuse curmudgeon who takes impassive delight in alienating anyone within range?
auth_sentence.res_content: Or the obtuse curmudgeon who takes impassive delight in alienating anyone within range?
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Or the obtuse curmudgeon who takes impassive delight in alienating anyone within range?

auth_sentence.content: How obtuse I had been not to suspect some trouble at home behind Grass's aggressive behaviour.
auth_sentence.res_content: How obtuse I had been not to suspect some trouble at home behind Grass's aggressive behaviour.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: How obtuse I had been not to suspect some trouble at home behind Grass's aggressive behaviour.

stems_affixes.word_buile: ob逆,倒,反,加强意义+lique歪斜→歪斜的
oblivion[[n.忘却,忘记]]男→adj.不在意的,疏忽的
obs=ob逆,倒,反,加强意义+cure关心→不关心→记不住了→模糊的
ob离开+sol太阳+ete→离开太阳了→放在角落不用了
obt=ob逆,倒,反,加强意义+use用→不能用了→钝的
ob逆,倒,反,加强意义+liv活+ion表名词→[记忆]不活了→忘记

means.word_mean: 迟钝的；(疼痛)不剧烈的；(印象)不鲜明的
